website_summaries.verdict: Built tough and can handle cutting through some of the sturdiest materials.
pros: Lasts a long time even with extended use
Provides clean and accurate bevel cuts
cons: Some reports of broken products, poor customer service

website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few quirks, this lightweight and powerful tool offers decent quality and a good value.
pros: Boasts impressive features for a low price that include stable, accurate cutting ability, roomy table, and reliable material clamp
cons: Laser could be better, and fence is somewhat flimsy
Some consumers had issues with the warranty being honored

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable for the price, but!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st saw of this style. Intro before I sink a lot of money into it. For the price, it's ok. However, after VERY light use, I noticed a crack on one of the feet. Honestly, I'm not sure if it was there when I opened it or not, but so far it may only have 30 minutes of use - so it's unacceptable. Some epoxy will keep it from growing, but it's the point of the matter. Please see attached pic.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Unit arrived broken and FAT BOY TOOLS didn't wanted to exchange base
customer_reviews.text: I received the item from FAT BbOY TOOLS. The saw arrived and all looked good until I noticed that the aluminium base had several cracks. Contacted FAT BOY TOOLS, they told me I had to contact HITACHI for warranty...... which is basically a waste of time. See the pictures of the bad quality
customer_reviews.author: Juergen Koska

customer_reviews.title: Blade Guard Issue
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the blade guard came from the factory loose. I cut a few times and then the blade caught the guard, which shot plastic everywhere (including hitting me in the face, thankfully I had safety glasses on) and bent the metal guard guide that opens and closes the guard when you cut. The guard no longer functions properly making the saw totally useless. I will be getting a different brand going forward. If you get one of these saws, make sure to check everything is securely fastened! I tried to return to Amazon, but it appears I am too late.
customer_reviews.author: kaleigh dimillo

customer_reviews.title: Death trap waiting to happen
customer_reviews.text: This thing almost took my eye out. The bracket used to butt wood up to exploded on my third use. Would have taken my eye out if I didn’t have protection on. This was brittle failure due to poor casting and stress relief. I asked metabo for help and they gave me the run around. All I want is a new chop saw but have contacted an attorney due to metabo’s poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Weak saw base. It was made out of cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I just just open the box and as soon as i take it out of the box. I saw the broken pieces. I havent tried the saw yet but im hoping it wont disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Geramie Y.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This saw is Aesthetically pleasing to look at. It’s sturdy, heavy duty, stable and accurate in its cut. My husband loves it. Slowly but surely building his wood working shop
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Even a novice can use this.
customer_reviews.text: The first photograph was before I bought this saw and the workbench my father left. The second was after. Now you tell me, was it worth it? I'm not a woodworker, but this saw helped me to build my own space.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Very poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor build quality after 3 uses the fence broke off. Contacted Hitachi and was told that they do not cover that part, even though the saw is only 5 months old. Will not be buying any other other products by Hitachi.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: BAD BEARING
customer_reviews.text: initially I was very impressed and put it to good use then I started hearing a grinding noise I thought the blade as loose. Checked the blade it wasn't loose the sound persisted I believe its a bearing VERY DISAPOINTED NOW ! lasted 6 months cutting nothing but 1" pine boards
customer_reviews.author: Russell C. Naughton

customer_reviews.title: You are on your own past Amazon return date
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas 2018...she is our Tool time girl. We were in the process of moving and she never got to use it until we got settled into our new home. She got two cuts made on her first project and the motor failed. Too late for a return to Amazon. Will be interesting to see what Hitachi does. Would not recommend...actually a 000 would be the best rating I could give. Update: contacted Hitachi through their website and got no response other than automated "we received your inquiry"
customer_reviews.author: Stan T

customer_reviews.title: A good option for the laymen, not for contractors. A decent cheaper option, though.
customer_reviews.text: If you just need to get something cheap to get a handful of jobs done, then this would be a good option. You get what you pay for. It cut well, but everything else about the product was noticeably cheap in quality (still an okay product overall for the money). In hindsight, I would've been more comfortable paying 65-70 dollars, but it was great to have an option on the lower end of the price range, and for what it is, it's pretty good. I'm giving 3 stars instead of 4 because one of the mounting bolts was cracked on arrival. Not a great sign of durability. Cheap metal base.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T Witmer

customer_reviews.title: Quality machine
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is a very good 10" miter saw. You can't really expect more especially at this price. I also have two Dewalt 12" miter saws that are not any better except for the tilt, larger saw blade and stronger motor. The only thing that you have to do is check the screws (like in any other machine) check the cut accuracy and if necessary, adjust. It is also advisable to buy a good blade, just like other manufacturers, you get a simple blade with the machine. The reason I bought this machine is for the light weight and therefor very good for mobile use.
customer_reviews.author: CLL

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Started smoking and giving off a horrible smell second time using it. Spend a little more for a much better one.
customer_reviews.author: Ron D

customer_reviews.title: Saw appears to lose power
customer_reviews.text: Hi, Wanted to add something that might help others. Not sure if this is just my saw or just how it works. Used it a few times and it cut fine. Then the saw appeared to lose power and wouldn’t cut even a simple door molding less than.3/4’s of an inch thick. What I found is you have to let the saw come up to speed. If you are having this problem let it run a good 5 to 10 seconds before attempting the cut. You can hear it. It sounds like it starts out slow and then it comes up to full speed. If you do this you can get good clean cuts.
customer_reviews.author: East-West Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Serious QA issues that may result in injury
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have unboxed and put it together. I find that the lower blade guard is very loose and can easily touch the blade upon use. Also, the blade guard is cheap hard brittle plastic. Will put on some protective equipment before powering it on and testing it out. Update: I took out the saw blade to see if I can tighten the lower blade guard, but doesn’t seem to tighten. This is a serious design flaw. Guess, I won’t try this brand anymore. Too dangerous to use. Will return. It’s a shame that companies will not attend to design flaws prior to selling their products.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Park

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The saw itself it ok, but features are terrible. To start off the instructions are horrible and refer you to figures that are not there. The factory set alignment is way off. I purchased this because it has a dust port which pretty much collects no dust and the design makes it difficult to get a good seal to attach a vac. If you use the clamp it won't cut through wood because the clamp hits the motor. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LHaynes

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: The back fence is bent, so the end cuts of my hardwood floor in the doorway goes diagonally from one side to the other. A chop saw has to do one thing, and this one fails on a simple 90 degree cut. I noticed too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.L.H.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for just $80 on Amazon. No need for laser if you eyeball the blade location with the wood before cutting. Can’t beat the price. It’s small and not too heavy either. Built a bed frame support quickly and easily with this. See pic.
customer_reviews.author: johnny0723

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Saw works fine, came with an OK blade for my purpose at the time. My concern was that the item had been repackaged. the cord was folded loosley and the twist tie had been reused. the plastic bag covering the saw was torn. i hope they had just relabeled the unit and that it wasn't refurhbished since it was sold as new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable deal on a high quality chop saw
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. Sharp and precise blade from factory. Super easy setup out of the box. The sawdust collection bag gets like 85% of the cut dust. But that's better than it not functioning at all. I made a stand to secure it to with outrigger stands to hold long length trim boards and other long pieces to be cut. Super easy to change the angle of the table and blade to make almost any angle cut you want. The lock down bar to help hold items to the fence works exactly as it should. I would definitely buy again or recommend to anyone needing a light/medium duty chop saw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Newman

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw for novice DIYer like me.
customer_reviews.text: As a novice DIYer, this works perfect for my needs. Slide would be nice for wider boards, but can easily flip and cut if need be. So far two jobs down and I can't be happier. Light weight and easily transported to job site.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am a DIY newbie and have been remodeling my new home for a year now. I was given a basic miter saw that just wasn’t doing what I needed it to do. I did a little research and purchased this one and it is perfect for me. Since I’ve never owned one before I had to watch a couple of YouTube videos to set it up out of the box, but it was extremely easy.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lot of BANG for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the saw twice so far. I mounted it to a couple of 2x4 boards 4 ft long. I set the entire rig on a couple of saw horses and it works great. I checked the settings on the 90° mark and 45° marks and according to my square, they were spot on. I then did a test cut and rechecked and again the cuts were on the mark. This miter saw is heavy enough to do most jobs for a home owner and light enough to move around easily. I would recommend this for a home owner handyman but it probably be under powered for a professional carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: Harley R.

customer_reviews.title: Seems good for a novice and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest: I'm not the most handy guy on the block. I needed this for very occasional use, and considering the price, I got my investment back on the first use. Once I put it together (it took me a couple hours; I suspect less nervous guys would do it in under an hour), it worked very nicely. Gave me the cuts I needed... and none that I didn't (I still have 10 fingers and two eyes!)
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Good for general use.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my purpose. Would have liked side supports for cutting but does well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Jacobi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is worth it's weight in gold. I thought I made a mistake buying a smaller saw for the projects I was taking on, but, it did much more than I anticipated. I used a Dewalt table saw as well as this saw to complete a full built in closet. I didn't have to adjust much out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: DMT

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY PHENOMENAL SAW!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We just received this saw and already put it to good use building our new pergola. This thing is a monster and can EASILY cut through pretty much anything we threw at it with ease. It's incredibly powerful, rock-solid and a breeze to use. We could have spent $200 - $300 on other brands but this is the absolute perfect saw for the majority of DIY homeowners in my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This is my first compound miter saw so I can't really rate its features relative to other models. I just can't believe I waited so long to finally buy one. So far I've used it for a project requiring many 45 degree cuts of 2x2 lumber as well as cutting down 4x4, 2x6 and 2x8 lumber. The 2x8 cuts required two passes, as would be expected. The saw is easy enough to move around and store and seems pretty accurate to me, but I haven't done any compound cuts-like a picture frame- to see how well it does at precise cuts. The sawdust collector works pretty well too.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Miter Saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Miter Saw. Worked straight out of the Box. I used it to make a long bench out of 2 by 4 I got at home depot. Worked like a charm both straight cuts and angle cuts. It cut through the pine like it was butter. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Herb H

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought a higher priced Kobalt 10" miter saw which didn't perform as I had expected, the laser would not stay in position and the saw base was not level on the sides with the saw deck. I returned it and after reading the reviews on this saw I purchased it with reservations thinking I only had a few cuts to make. I was totally surprised with the acracy and quality of this saw. I highly recommend this saw for the DIY person that wants to make professional cuts on molding and trim. I am totally pleased with the performance and will be using this saw for other projects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Coplin SR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic deal for the money!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the bad reviews are about on here but my saw works great. After a little time getting familiar with the settings and setup, it’s working great. 2 months in with moderate use, no problems at all. Fantastic deal for the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dnice

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Simple Jobs
customer_reviews.text: We just got a home and have realized the need for a power saw. This miter saw was purchased for a molding project, and it's saved me so much time and hassle. I've since used it for several other sawing tasks at home. The 10-in blade is a bit small for some projects (cutting 2x10s for a raised bed needed two cuts) but for the price ($90 when I purchased it), its been totally worth it. It's been able to handle any task we've given it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for cutting at angle 6" deck board.
customer_reviews.text: Got this saw for cutting my 5.5" deck boards replacement. My deck has chevron pattern so it needs 45-50degree cuts and I only able to cut 2/3 of the 5.5inch board. I can do the trick by raising the boards up 2-3 inch to complete the cut but for safety reason no thanks. I have to borrow my neighbor's metabo slider mitre saw, that one run on 18v battery.
customer_reviews.author: T. Luong

customer_reviews.title: Reviewing after two-year use!
customer_reviews.text: I came across this product and noticed I never reviewed it on Amazon. Therefore, I decided to write my opinion about this saw after using it for about two years. I performed numerous jobs with this item and I am %100 satisfied of its quality and performance. Extremely handy. For the money I paid, I could never buy a better saw! Impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Zandi

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable deal.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this saw! Cuts laminate flooring and 2×4s with ease. Not so great on wet or pressure treated lumber, but it will do for a smaller project.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M. Busler

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price! For small woodworking only!
customer_reviews.text: This little miter saw is great. It cuts clean and sharp and is super user friendly. The directions were lacking clarity though, so for setup, I honestly just looked at the pictures of it on Amazon to figure out where everything went. Keep in mind, it's diameter only allows it to cut so deep and so far in, you will not be able to make large woodworking projects with this. However, it's great for a quick, small cut. It also came out of the box accurately aligned with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: It works! Good for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.text: Good price. The quality is good (not the best - but for the price! - you can't beat it). I use it for all-around work. I didn't want to put my more expensive miter saw in the back of my truck while traveling long distances. So if this one get's stolen or falls on a dirt road around the ranch - I would not feel so bad. But so far, it is still chugging and working!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mav

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: Thing works great cut my laminate, base boards and 2x4 no issues. I just did not have $300 so for half the price this thing delivered.
customer_reviews.author: The Roc

customer_reviews.title: My first miter saw!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw for my first home improvement project and it was a great purchase. I don't have anything to compare it to as this is my first miter saw, but quite honesty it was easy to set up and use and I felt like I had a good rhythm using it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners and small jobs. Can't beat price!
customer_reviews.text: Nice miter saw for the price you can't beat it really. Great for small odd jobs or if you are a beginner. Downfall is no slide rail in order to cut wide boards in just one cut, you have to flip to finish cut. Also the blade that it comes with is good but more for rough cuts if looking for finer smooth cuts you will need to purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Harrod

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great low end miter saw. In mine, the angle measurements are spot on for the carriage, but the actual blade angle settings are a few degrees off. As such, it's impossible to get an absolutely perfect 90 degree cut. I could probably fix this issue if I was willing to tear this down and do some minor modifications, but honestly it's so close that I haven't bothered. And lets be honest, you're using this to chop lumber not to do absolute precision work. This is a case where more than powerful enough and "close enough" on the angles is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: E. Dobratz

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get one of these years ago?
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old guy, and I've spent my whole life avoiding making miter cuts because I could never do them well, and that's putting it charitably. It turns out the reason was that I wasn't using the right equipment. This thing is great! The pieces I cut with it actually fit together. Perfectly! And it's easy! Who knew? Some of you did. Why didn't anybody tell me? I wasted so many years! I didn't choose the model with the laser cut indicator, and I sort of wish I had, because I'm still learning how to set the cut at the exact right length, but I can work with that.
customer_reviews.author: Guglielmo

customer_reviews.title: Beginners Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is on of my first miter saws. I love to do a little of woodworking and have wanted a miter saw for months, but since being on a budget I thought to try this product as an investment without spending top dollar and build up more toys to add to my husbands garage for me to make new projects.
customer_reviews.author: naolanani k hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw with minor annoyances
customer_reviews.text: Other than disfunctional dust collector and flimsy hold-down clamp, so far it's been a good saw. Tolerances are close and there isn't any slop in the hinge mechanism. It came with a good general-purpose blade and didn't need any adjustments to cut accurately. Changing the blade could be a little less awkward: there isn't any way to hold the guard out of the way and the tiny Phillips head screw in the access plate to access the spindle seems committed to a short life. All told, a bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Colcord

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Saw works very well. Out of the box the angles were perfect. Comes with a decent saw blade. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but positive things to say about this saw. For the price you can’t beat it. So cheap I thought I bought a piece of garbage, but I was proven wrong. The way this saw performed surprised me. The time test is the real test though. I’ve only had it for a few months, and only did some small projects. But It cut 2x6’s, and 4x4’s no problem. It’s small and light. Easy to carry. I love it. If it broke today, I’d say I got my money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L Neumann

customer_reviews.title: NICE ! !
customer_reviews.text: Does EVERYTHING I want to do, everything I needed to do and looks good doing it ! Used it do install window and floor molding in an entire house inside and all exterior work ! Friend across the street bought one, took off the blade guard. Proceeded to cut off a nice portion of his thumb. Not a stupid man, he told me he now knows why they install a guard over the blade !
customer_reviews.author: Grandma's Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Good deal on a great saw
customer_reviews.text: I had been eying the same saw at a local home improvement store and saw that it was about 30.00 cheaper here. Other comments say that the instructions are unclear, but I had this thing set up and cutting wood in about 10 minutes. I have used it to cut laminate, molding, crown molding, and trim in our new home and it has given me zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Todd Halpin

customer_reviews.title: Miter saw for all
customer_reviews.text: This is the newer brand name for Hitachi. Great product, delivered on time and cuts like butter. Only includes one blade, but cuts great. Good power too. Great assembly instructions. Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: My first miter saw!
customer_reviews.text: During a recent bathroom remodel, I bought this saw to help with the angled cuts. Not only did it cut extremely well, I was able to complete the whole project in record time! Except for a brief issue with finding the locking pin, this saw has been nothing but miraculous with me! I'm now moving on to other projects and it continues to perform well!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for this segment.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent miter saw for the home gamer’s shop or garage. Excellent way to get your first exposure to Hiatchi power tools, which is now Metabo HPT (HPT= Hitatchi Power Tools) It’s bare bones but every feature it has is super solid and frankly I find the adjustments more solid than on the model up with the laser.
customer_reviews.author: Fee Nicks

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner to wood working. Had never used a miter saw. THIS SAW IS GREAT! We used it to build a fence, an outside sectional, frames, welcome signs, etc etc. It cuts well, it really accurate, and cleans up easily!
customer_reviews.author: Dallin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Did the job for a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: I should probably wait awhile before writing a review, but this unit cut lots of lumber for me with no issue. Very intuitive and easy to use, and the miter functions work great. Just barely cuts a 4x4, but really, that's exactly why I bought it - that's the max I needed. No issues whatsoever. Well, the sawdust catcher doesn't work very well, but they never do from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: For $99 it's the best saw you can get. It uses old school brush motors like they used in the 1920s but it works. It's a little flimsy and not very sturdy but it gets the job done. No complaints for a saw that's less than $100
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: So far i'm pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have had this over a month now and use it almost daily to make between 6 to 10 cuts, It doesn't have all the bell and whistles of some more expensive saws I looked at, but it makes True cuts, doesn't bog down and hasn't broken, also it was a good price. I'm satisfied and I would buy this again or recommend this to a friend or family member looking for a saw in this price range
customer_reviews.author: jeff tucker

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money.  Very smooth cuts.
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw. Instructions are very weak but it has a nice blade on it and cuts very smooth, like buttah. I was cutting western red cedar. You will need a wrench to remove a big bolt that it ships with, and the horseshoe shaped thing goes on the back (very little info about that in the manual). The casting on the blade guard is pretty irregular but the saw works well for the price. It also has an automatic blade brake which is nice (maybe they all have this, I don't know)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken and not due to shipping mishandling. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken and not due to shipping mishandling. The base had several pieces broken off from being made of cheap pot metal. I won't be purchasing anything from Hitachi again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For my tool inventory is the best for the money. How I should put this; I do works for my own house projects and there is no need for industrial grade products, the major need is diversity in tools. And for the price you have a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Yariel Palacios

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: My pops who worked construction for years swears by hitachi. The price is great for what you get we have used this non stop since our purchase and couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great. This is my first miter saw and I don't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Googalabosh

customer_reviews.title: The Instruction Manual Is Poorly written.
customer_reviews.text: The directions are hard to follow. I could not easily find the directions for installing the sub fence, plate (A), and Side Handle. The diagram for the Holder in the directions did not match the diagram for the Holder in the Standard Accessories diagram. I'm unable to attach the Holder.
customer_reviews.author: Blu

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We put laminate flooring throughout our upstairs last week and had planned on renting a saw but my husband decided it would be better just to buy an inexpensive one. After reading through reviews we decided on this one and were very impressed! It did a great job! As others have mentioned, the sawdust catcher isn't the best, we used it outside to avoid the mess and it doesn't have a slide. But otherwise a really good saw for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for Occasional Light-Duty Work
customer_reviews.text: At $99, this is an adequate chop saw for light-duty work. It has a serious flaw in that the base is so light the saw shifts around (and tips over easily) unless it is clamped to the work surface. The vacuum pick simply doesn't work without copious use of duct tape. This is a cheap version of a much better saw Hitachi made 20 years ago. Functional but not pro-quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Ebersole

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really excellent tool. Cuts are clean and very accurate. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: M. Purvis

customer_reviews.title: and great indexing on the 45% angle
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on small wood pieces...Clean cuts, and great indexing on the 45% angle. We have been using this to make picture frames, and it is just the ticket. It really needs two clamps, shame it only comes with one, you have to keep moving it from side to side. I also dont think the dust bag works very well. I even tried connecting a shopvac to the dust port to suck it out, but it didnt work for us. i guess cutting wood makes wood chips!!!
customer_reviews.author: kim DiDonato-Murrell

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was ecstatic about this saw. He had read reviews on it and wanted a somewhat affordable one to start out with. I surprised him with it for his birthday and he has used it sooooo much. It has definitely been a nice investment and addition to his small novice shop. He says the quality is way more than he expected and is pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a excellent saw at a very low price point, almost to good to be true. I have used this saw now for several projects including installing baseboard it adjusts and cuts to 45 degree angles seamlessly and cuts like butter every time I can't get over how well this saw works for the price. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cecchetti

customer_reviews.title: For light work.
customer_reviews.text: I realized that I was not getting a square cut then I check and saw that the preset 90 degree angle on the saw is not very accurate. After using a square to set the the blade it only work for squaring edges but not long pieces. It is then that I realized that the fence has a bow it is not flat. I guest you get what you pay for. It can work for light odd jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for trim. Wish it had a laser marker.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN D SANDERLIN

customer_reviews.title: Base is POT METAL
customer_reviews.text: Beware - the actual base of this saw is "pot metal" and actually broke where the additional handle is to be located! Hope it works better than it has so far.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Make time for the unpacking
customer_reviews.text: When my saw arrived I had a little difficulty with getting it out of the travel configuration. The bolts that held it at a 45 degree bevel (front to back) and a 45 degree angle (left to right) were very tight. Once I got that figured out and set up, it worked beautifully. It is a bit awkward to move when it's not mounted on a stand(hence the 4 stars on maneuverability).
customer_reviews.author: David Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My wood working knowledge is, make a line to cut on, cut said line. This miter saw is super easy to use and cuts beautifully. The biggest challenge was assembly but, even that wasn't too bad. If you are looking for a low cost, easy to use, quality product. This is it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Saw was in excellent condition on receipt
customer_reviews.text: Remember that this saw needs to have adjustments made to make 0 or 90 cuts accurately. I had to use a right angle on the deck and blade and then adjust the bolt to get the correct reading. Once this is done, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Value
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase! Can't believe I waited so long. Should have bought this saw 3 projects ago!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy James

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well 2/27/19 Update, the on button/trigger doesn't work properly and the back wall where you put the lumber is not straight. This machine has gone downhill while trying to get straight cuts. 3/10 tried contacting customer service, they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: J-rod

customer_reviews.title: The saw worked perfectly quickly and easily cutting through panels at the perfect angles
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw to cut and install laminate flooring. The saw worked perfectly quickly and easily cutting through panels at the perfect angles. Used for a few other small framing jobs and has been working well. Only issue was the amount of dust when cutting laminate. Even with the bag installed it created a huge amount of dust throughout the area. Recommend to use outside. But otherwise I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: price
customer_reviews.text: My sons fancy Kobalt quit ,(Lowes would not replace) and we needed another for crown molding , door trim, and base board + straight cuts , did the job,
customer_reviews.author: papa

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the shop
customer_reviews.text: Great quality saw! If I was setting it up and taking it down everyday like I did when I was a contractor I think the base would be in danger of breaking. It's a fairly thin cast metal. But mounted in my shop I have been really happy this this!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Spiess

customer_reviews.title: The used ones are garbage
customer_reviews.text: I love metabo stuff and think they are way underrated, but buying a amazon used one was a joke... the saw came with a giant hole in the box and was missing about half the accessories. Sent it right back. I’m not sure how it cuts or functions considering everything was missing
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Pay a little more....
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months. I guess you get whst you pay for. Had a delta miter saw for 20 years before the motor burned up. If you are wanting something to last longer than 6 months, pay a little more. I would call this a throw away saw, just like walmart t shirts.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Olar

customer_reviews.title: Good saw. Terrible directions.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are awful! Take your time when setting up because the pictures and information given is lacking in detail. Other than that, once I figured it out I have had no trouble with the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie M

customer_reviews.title: For small projects around the house this is perfect. It may not be a dual bevel compound ...
customer_reviews.text: For small projects around the house this is perfect. It may not be a dual bevel compound but it works perfect. I would not recommend if this tool is what helps you make a living but for small projects around the house it is great. We did all of our baseboards after laying laminate flooring. I looked up a youtube video to better understand how to use it and I have to say I made a new friend. Didn't even let the husband use it. It was super easy and nice clean cuts. Would recommend to anyone who wants to do their own home improvements or even hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: OK so maybe I’m not a woodworking genius But this is the first time in my life I’ve actually been able to Make a straight cut with a saw And I am 69 years old The only thing I regret is I didn’t get a saw that can Go forward and back but I was able to maneuver enough to cut a 20 inch board
customer_reviews.author: jack davanzo

customer_reviews.title: this thing is awsome
customer_reviews.text: I am retired. last week I started building bird houses. I was using a hand saw and I never could cut the board straight.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara s Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw; well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband in a Black Friday special. He has a more professional model compound miter saw that does more but wanted a lighter weight one for certain uses and when transporting and moving it around. This fit the bill perfectly and he is very happy with it. Nice saw and made well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: still rips pretty hard, way better than a hand saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw is only square on one side. somehow the fence is off a 16th or more. kind of a bummer, still rips pretty hard, way better than a hand saw, but limited in its precision, can be a real bummer when trying to cut something wide, when you flip the work over to complete the cut, the error is obvious. Should have spent the extra money for a better saw, but not sad to have this thing around for rough cuts. For what it cost it could still make you a lot of money, hoping if i remove the fence and build my own that the problem will be solved
customer_reviews.author: Parker Mitchell-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: Girlfriend got me the exact same one for a gift. Great minds think alike when it comes to Great saws.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: the saw
customer_reviews.text: the saw is a very nice nice piece of equipment it was just like how it was ordred
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a workhorse! I have always like Hitachi power tools (Hitachi is now Metabo) and this one is as good as my others. Building rooms in a basement and this thing has not failed. We cut 2-2x4’s at once to save time and this thing is like cutting through butter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Miter Saw for $100 All Day!
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by the quality of this Miter Saw! Paid $99, seriously?! Amazing! Other than the 1 day delay on the shipping (understandable) I couldn't be happier! Would buy again, and will!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on August 12th, attempted to use on August 14th. The motor making a grinding noise, the blade stops spinning and smoke is coming from motor. POS is Going Back!
customer_reviews.author: K. Pollock

customer_reviews.title: You get what you expect from Hitachi :)
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi is know for its quality and 5 year warranty and this product does not disappoint you. Metabo HPT Compound Miter Saw, is the one I was looking for long time and when promotion came on this, i purchased immediately. 10 Inch is way better than 7 inch and its easy to operate. I tried cutting on different angle and its works so smooth. cant't tell you. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ranvijay Singh

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but functions well
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about how well this low priced chopsaw would prove to be. Needn't have worried. It set up easily and was accurate out of the box. It's a good tool for occasional work.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyEd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a couple of years ago and somehow managed to crack the baseplate. Liked it so much for the price that I invested in a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Z

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat this saw. It’s gotten us through many projects.
customer_reviews.author: adrienne

customer_reviews.title: NOT ready out of box
customer_reviews.text: You MUST adjust the positive stop screws - make sure the blade angle stops @ 90 and 45 along the Y axis before making your cuts - the angle indicator on the Y axis is not accurate - tempted to return but after adjustments, it seems to run fine (eye roll) 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: digiMyAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw a handful of times and it started making a grinding noise and the blade would barely spin. Seller was not will to take care of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Perfect entry level saw
customer_reviews.text: For less then $100 great miter saw. Easy setup despite some less then stellar instructions. No enough to lose a star but close. Saw blade that came is a very coarse cut, so bought some finer blades. Easy enough to change the blades. Vice attachment nice feature on a entry level saw. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: chop66

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic miter saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw has excellent reviews for a reason. It's reasonably priced for its high quality, plus it has a 10" blade size. I don't miss having a laser light (prefer doing it by eye) and the cuts are super clean, especially if you buy an 80 tooth blade for moulding cuts. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ZQ

customer_reviews.title: Compound mitre saw
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely loved this saw , it came with extra parts to cut crown molding and he was thrilled , absolutely worth the price and then some ... very very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Davis
